instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.  Was liquid damaged around <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.  pin 30 testpoint was corroded out.  i replaced the chip and ran a wire to <RESISTOR>R7280</RESISTOR>.  i now get fan spin for 15 seconds turns off then back on full speed.  no led flashing on pen drive.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check continuity with <RESISTOR>R0812</RESISTOR>.
Do you get VCORE?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
no <RESISTOR>R7280</RESISTOR> does not have  continuity with <RESISTOR>R0812</RESISTOR>.

i do have vcore 1.7v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: ran the trace and now have boot!  thanks.
